page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: I live on a farm. The crops we grow on the farm are corn, barley, silage, hay, potatoes and turnips. When the barley is cut it is taken to the farm by trailer. It is put into a bruiser which flattens the barley. We keep cattle and sheep. We feed the cattle the bruised barley or bruisen with their silage and it makes them fat so they make a good price at the slaughter house.We feed the sheep hay, turnips and sometimes bruisen. If you had a farm which was mostly hill land your best choice of sheep would be blackface.They can be left on a hill for nearly a week without getting stuck on their backs. Some of the fields in the valley are sown out in grass so there is enough for the cattle to eat fresh in the summer and as silage or hay in the winter.
